alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 26 at 11:12PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of Alabama and southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, in Alabama, Choctaw, Clarke and Wilcox. In southeast Mississippi, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1107 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a band of moderate rain continuing to move over areas effected earlier by heavy rains due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding remains ongoing in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thomasville, Camden, Pine Hill, Silas, Fulton, Gilbertown, Yellow Bluff, Toxey, Tallahatta Springs, Glover, Springfield, Rural, Campbell, Chilton, Roundhill, McEntyre, Morvin, Failetown, Greenwood and Finley Crossing.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
